questions.question: 1. A constitution for the people of France was      first promised in which of the following?
2.The Declaration of the Rights of Man and  Citizen was influenced by

choices.answer: Both Enlightenment and Declaration of Independence

questions.question: 3. One important result of the French Revolution was that:

choices.answer: France enjoyed a lengthy period of peace and prosperity
Political power shifted to the bourgeoisie
The Church got back its former role in  the French govt
France lost its spirit of nationalism

questions.question: 4. What economic problems did France face in the  1770’s?

choices.answer: The French government was nearly bankrupt
European wars had drained the treasury
The price of bread had skyrocketed

questions.question: 5. Which of the following was not a cause of the French Revolution?
6. About what percentage of France’s population belonged to the Third Estate?
7. The reign of terror resulted in which development?

choices.answer: The establishment of a lasting republic
The First Estate controlling the government

questions.question: 8. Napoleon Bonaparte made several changes in      France’s government including:

choices.answer: Making tax collection more fair and orderly

questions.question: 9. Under Napoleon’s rule, France conquered all EXCEPT:

choices.answer: to force Russia to trade with France
to enforce the terms of the Continental System
he was unsatisfied with his power and territory in 1812.
to prove he was stronger than the Pope

questions.question: 11. Which is not true of the Declaration of Rights of Man and Citizen?

choices.answer: Came out of the French revolution
Men are born and remain free and equal

questions.question: 12. Marie Antoinette was a source of anger and      hostility for France because:

choices.answer: She was known as Madame Deficit
The pledge to create a new constitution for       France
The introduction to the Declaration of the Rights of Man
A promise from King Louis to help save France
A promise to storm the Bastille
